or not?” And they might remember, for example, “When I drank, all these problems occurred.
And when I didn’t drink, those problems didn’t occur.” By this simple remembrance, the person
may understand the law that brought forth good was. “Don’t drink alcohol.” This is the
symbolism of Aaron’s rod budding over the others, which may have said, “Do drink alcohol,”
and brought forth no flowers.
Memory is essential for building one’s own character. Memory, in fact, is the portion that
allows one to develop and be created by God as life progresses. Aaron’s rod represents memory
according to the law, and what bears actual fruit. It represents one’s capacity to renew by
learning new things and changing their mind. For it is good for one to change in accordance to
the law of God by learning things which cause no fruit and things that do cause fruit. And
therefore, the budding of Aaron's rod represents one's capacity for memory, learning, and change
for the beautiful.
Thus, these form the components of the ark of the covenant in the holiest place: The
capacity to learn (Aaron’s rod), the internal law and framework of understanding the world (the
tablets of covenant), and the sustenance for one’s spirit (manna from heaven, which is Christ).
These are all contained in the ark of the covenant, for they are necessary for one to obtain the
promise of Christ. First, the ability to learn so one may confess and repent. Second, the law of
God and covenant so someone may comprehend the desire to do so. Last, Christ’s sustenance, so
that one may be redeemed from their past failures and imperfections. And all of these things are
sustained also by sacrifice.
Lucifer, The Adversary
Love is the essential law of God. And love requires sacrifice. Therefore, all the
components of one’s inner temple which is good and capable of love requires sacrifice.
Therefore, if the inner sanctum was desecrated, love itself would be desecrated. And if sacrifice
was taken away as a requirement, then love itself would be taken away. Neuralink and Artificial
Intelligence fit the bill quite well for all these things, unfortunately.
To understand why these things will arrange together in the way I am about to predict, we
must note our understanding of the great sin of Lucifer. From the psychology of pride and satan
we may correlate the original and continual ultimate sin by the snake’s deception which occurs in
humanity. And by this sin, we may see how all the components I’ve outlined work together to be
erected in the bodily temple and accomplish the Canaanite and Babylonian vision. Moreover, we
may be able to, with this reasoning, justify how it forms into Neuralink and Artificial
Intelligence.
First of all, let's note what pride is. Pride is, on a basic level, a desire to be revered above
others and have power over others. This is correlated to the knowledge of good and evil, for the
original sin by the snake’s deception was pride. This is pride because inherently, a desire to be in
control and placed above others is a desire to be God. God, for example, is allowed to honor
Himself because all His works are good. Man is not allowed to honor himself, since not all his
works are good. And therefore, God is allowed the place of worship and authority, and man
continually strives to be in place of God. This, in the most fundamental sense, is what pride is;
the desire to usurp God.
We can further deduce how this is related to the knowledge of good and evil. To know
good and evil means to know every consequence, past experiences, intentions of heart, and
futures of all things and people. Moreover, it requires a knowledge of the fabric of the universe,
in a sense, to know whether the structures of existence are good (the philosophical debate of
nihilism, which Cain settles upon). God has—for what purpose or ability we have no
knowledge—decided to limit humans in their capacity to know the future or all things. He does
this, yet also gives them the free will to act and create by His own power and spirit, as man is
created in the image of God. This is how evil is introduced, since man in his limited knowledge
makes decisions that disagree with God’s design, and he is capable of such since He is given free
and creative spirit by God, which influences creation and reality.
God has designed it this way so we may operate based on faith. And because it must be
by faith, we then require an intent of heart, no matter the circumstances, to do good to others.
And therefore it is not by knowledge, but through the design, it is by faith in God one acts
righteously. And if one disagrees with this statement, either because they believe morals can be
deduced or God is wrong for this, then he is only participating in the same sin we are describing.
For committing this sin of pride, we may identify the primary motivations. In the garden,
Adam and Eve did not yet have sin and death, and we are told Eve’s motivations and the reasons
given by the serpent. First of all, the serpent offers the ability to be like God through implication.
This directly relates the sin to pride as we discussed. Eve also noticed it was pleasant food, and
desirable to make one wise. Therefore, our motivators are pride, wisdom, and appetite. But
primarily, we should start our discussion with appetite.
For it is by appetite and desire pride is the consequential conclusion. Since Eve desired
the apple, she faced a question: “Is it beneficial for me to eat this apple?” Now, according to
God, who created the universe and has authority over reality, He says it is not, because she will
die. The deception is, “I am more knowledgeable and powerful than reality itself (God), and
therefore, I am able to participate in this desired fruit without consequence, and it is good that I
do so.” This sort of reasoning is actually at the root of all sin, and this is how all sin is related to
pride; the original sin is not just in Eden, but it is the first sin every person makes.
For when someone steals, for example, their sin begins with a desire for the object. Then,
knowing the consequences of harm to others and their gained criminal situation, they face a
challenge to God. “I know this is wrong and will be bad for me and others, but I want this.”
Thus, the persuasion of that serpent begins, “Well, actually, this isn’t hurting others, and this is
what is right. Those capitalist pigs that eat off the backs of the poor deserve it anyways, so really
I’m doing everyone a favor. Besides, I’m not getting caught, I’ll just leave with it in my pocket.”
Therefore, whether it be consciously or subconsciously, one must justify their actions above
God’s authority to participate in their desire. Therefore, sin begins with desire for forbidden
pleasures, and it is realized by pride and usurpation of God.
In the story, Adam and Eve suffer the curses of God; for Adam, it is to work; for Eve, it is
to have much sorrow and pain in conception. These operate as preventative measures for them to
taste the forbidden fruit and become like God, as they are cast out of the garden. This is also
related to why wisdom is among the fruit, since wisdom allows access to manipulation, control,
power, and discovering more pleasures. And so, the natural component of pride is also a worship
of intellect. First, because intellect is your ability to justify your actions, which, when disobeying
God, acts as a replacement for love and faith. And therefore, as we are seeing in secular society,
people end up mistaking intellect and knowledge for morality. Moreover, intellect is worshipped
because it allows the people to control others and the world to their bidding, therefore forcing it
into what they want.
One strange thing about humans I can’t necessarily explain is that they have an inherent
desire to be worshipped. And so, intellect is, for this reason, also praised. It is access to power
and worthiness. I expect this desire may be encoded in humanity's sense of justice. One who has
intellect and exhibits control, in their pride, believes as if all they are doing is good, though they
might feel guilty. And therefore, it might follow, that because what they do is good, they deserve
the praise and worship of other people, so that thankfulness should be shown. But, we may
simply observe worship is something reserved for God, and for some reason, when one desires to
have the place of God, they also desire the things given to Him, like worship.
So, therefore, man will disobey God for worship, intellect, and pleasure. And these are
the root sins for all other sins, in which we may then categorize sins as worship for man’s pride,
intellect, and pleasures above God’s call for love and faith. However, it is not the use of intellect
or pleasure which God hates, but the disobedience of God by these things. For God provided that
all trees could be eaten, except the tree of pride and forbidden pleasure. And desiring freedom
from God’s rules, man was cast out of the garden, no longer free to eat of every tree, including
the tree of life.
This brings us to another very interesting aspect, which is the tree of life. God created the
universe and deliberately gave the curses of work and sorrow to Adam and Eve. I would argue
God did this for these things to act as inhibitors for their desire for the evil pleasures and
usurpation of God. Since God said, “lest they eat of the tree of life,” and therefore cast them out.
For if they ate of the tree of life, now possessing understanding of moral law and the forbidden
pleasures, they then would be, with enough longevity, able to be like God, and transcend the
bounds of the world to form their own worlds, which they desire. God, then, saw fit that their
actions were immoral not by the bounds of reality, but immoral by the bounds of metaphysical
reality; that is, by the bounds of the law of spirit rather than the physical.
For the law of God is given by Moses for the physical. The laws which keep one from
catastrophe in a world where work and sacrifice is required. But, in the garden, there was no
curse of work and sacrifice given. And therefore, there would be no bad consequences if they
participated in moral actions. If they continually stole from each other, for example, they could
continue in this evil because they won’t run out of resources produced for them by the paradise;
and if they did, and ended up in poverty, they still would not die. And therefore, there was no
limit to how depraved one could be, since they would not be stopped by death or other
restrictions of sacrifice.
God, therefore, decided that there exists a different type of immorality which is
unacceptable: that man should form the world and create it to his pleasures and things, which
would be devoid of love. And so, for this reason Adam was kicked out, so that he may be limited
in his ability to make his own sort of world according to his knowledge and desires. God, then,
sees man unfit to form a world. And for the problem of suffering, one might understand it to
exist because man was given free will and power near to God, and so that he may enjoy it
without creating hell, he is bound by Adam’s curses.
This fundamental disagreement is what motivates the apocalypse and man’s desire to
usurp God: he disagrees with how the world is made. That is to say, God doesn’t just disagree
with lust because it harms people physically and damages the prosperity of the community, but
he abhors lust because it damages the spiritual person—the inner heaven. So, therefore, man’s
desire to lust and avoid the consequences, even if he succeeded, is still evil. Moses’ law was a
correction of the physical world, but Jesus’ law was the correction of the internal world, which
was broken even after Adam. And therefore, the paradise of Jesus is different because the spirit
of the people who entered were already perfected into love, meaning they not only followed the
physical law, but the spiritual with their hearts, which was previously unbounded (now
unbounded in this age).
But as for those who disagree, they still desire the primary categories of sin: pride,
worship, pleasure, and intellect. But also, they desire eternal life—except of course, an eternal
life of their own. They want to partake of the tree of life, of which they are unable to. And as we
know from the story of Cain and our previous deduction, his contestment to God is directly
related to pride. For he desires things his own way, and he desires not to participate in the bounds
of reality required of him, which is to sacrifice, and therefore rejects sacrifice. For Cain, he
suffers the consequences. But therefore, his descendents strive continually for wisdom, so that
they may eat of the forbidden fruit without suffering the curse given to Adam. And this is why
the worship of intellect coincides with the rejection of sacrifice, for ingenuity and manipulation
subverts the requirement of oneself to suffer the laws of God’s wrath.
This is Musk’s line of reasoning, “because the people can’t be righteous, and we are on
our way of destruction, I may make AI and robotics which will sustain the people even in their
evil.” But this is the same reasoning as the engineers for the tower of babel, who sought on their
own pride a place in complete freedom of boundless skies, making heaven on their own name
rather than God’s, and believed themselves able to do so by towering above the flood waters.
And yet, God said it is able to be accomplished if man becomes one in language. And so, the
rejection to sacrifice, pride, engineering technology, worship of intellect—all these things
coincide with man’s ultimate sins. Therefore, we may relate the abomination of desolation and
elimination of sacrifice with man’s desire to become as God, and to therefore have the
characteristics of God, which is omniscience, omnipotence, authority, worship, and control.
Desecration of The Holiest Place
Therefore, the final accomplishment of Neuralink would be to merge with artificial
intelligence. We may consider the development of technology to coincide in goal, intention, and
completion when related to the elimination of sacrifice, therefore, to usurpation of God by power
and intellect. Since AI is a database of all collected knowledge, access to this by Neuralink
means ultimate amounts of knowledge—constant querying and answers from a collection of
human libraries and conclusions. It will allow humans to know solutions and depths of sciences
and languages in instants. Even now people rely on AI to do many things for them, and in
universities they are relied upon as teachers or companions. Even in basic life choices and
questions people rely on the help of AI to guide them, putting a sort of faith in it. There is an
increased reliance on AI, and human psyche indicates the merging of one’s mind with AI will be
the completion of this reliance; moreover, it would be the natural next step to worship the image
of the beast, since it would allow direct access for the eye and mind to any desired experience
generated by AI.
The other aspect of increased ability and intelligence is the combination of the people by
telepathic communication. People gain great ability by communicating with each other, because
people are able to convey dense amounts of ordered information they’ve already done the effort
to sort through to other people, and therefore form it around a goal or idea cleanly; therefore,
one’s wisdom is accelerated by conversations more so than it would be by independent
discovery. This manner of discussion is actually how scientific literature is formed, since people
can put together large databases of different subjects to build upon each other’s knowledge.
Music, mathematics, and physics depend upon the same definitions to work together in building
and creating things. Programming itself is dependent on the computers being connected in a
language.
Therefore, the next step of expanded intellect would be the merging of minds, thereby
enacting the most express form of communication and wisdom. This is possible by the
connection of minds in the digital realm, and we already have the technologies capable of
reading brain functions into words. Therefore, the people’s collective capacity for knowledge
would extend their intelligence to comprehend the grandest of things with no work effort of their
own, and so, therefore, the merging of Neuralink to be a collective database of all human minds
communicating to each other and to Artificial intelligence will likely be the final resolution of
Canaanite desire. And because we know these things are both possible, supported by prophecy,
supported by developing philosophies and people, and likely according to human psychology, we
may conclude it is a reasonable prediction. Let me remind my reader that God said that, because
the people become “as one” they can accomplish all they propose. Therefore, this Neuralink is
the completion of Cain to attain all wisdom, sort of brought about by eating of a tree of life, since
their mind becomes composed of all the knowledge of human’s generations past and current.
Moreover, this would allow infinite worship of the image of the beast and access to
indulgences, because the people who enter into this system may have all their sensory data
influenced with projections of any abomination they desire. Not bound by the laws of reality.
They, therefore, would achieve the tower of babel, which is to extend into the boundless heavens
on their own name and laws; they would create a boundless empire by the image of the beast, in
which they indulge their false heaven of infinite sensualism, having sensory data, images, and
worlds produced by artificial intelligence at no bounds within their mind.
It is not a question of whether such technologies are possible, but rather if humanity
would subject themselves to such a thing. I imagine yes. That when humanity sustains itself
outwardly with robotic automation (the first beast) they will then be persuaded to enter into a
hive mind due to their lusts for knowledge, power, and fleshly desires. We may also be certain
such a thing will occur by prophecy, since it is the accomplishment of all the things proposed to
do in the original tower of babel. It is the attempt to reach boundlessness in the skies (the tower
to heaven). This is done so by allowing infinite sensualism with no consequences or requirement
for sacrifice. It also is the making of the people “as one.” Since entering into a massive system of
combined telepathic communication is essentially combining your mind with other minds into
one massive one. It is for this reason, also, that I speculate the mention of the mark of the beast
being the name of a man might be understood as the name of an entire empire—the amalgamated
beast. Since the people become as one being and accomplish the will of imperfect man, carrying
the name Neuralink, which is literally a name referencing connection of neurons and brains.
This is therefore the accomplishment of man taking away any necessity of sacrifice
within himself. And therefore, he takes away his capacity to love. And this doesn’t only take
place in the level of indulgence as we know, but also in the level of its deepest sense, unto the
desecration of the spirit itself within him. And, when man attains such a level of intellect, he may
even begin desecration and war on heaven and saints in a metaphysical reality we don’t currently
understand. He severs the connection of his body to God completely, and makes it bestial. This is
done when he learns his own desires of love and sacrifice in the holiest place work against his
heaven of sensualism, and he therefore decides to desecrate the holiest place within him. He
must eliminate his desire for love.
First, the establishment of a programmed system to replace is internal neuroplasticity and
DNA. This is the throwing away of Aaron’s rod, for the man prevents himself of change, and
merges himself completely with a computer which operates by levers and switches, incapable of
change, interaction with quantum potential (may physicists comprehend me), or creation of
memories. For all their memories and things are intermingled with others. Also, the false
projections of AI memories and worlds delude their comprehension of reality to any will of the
programmed set. They are no longer able to recognize which rod truly buds, they are incapable
of forming true memories, and are also, therefore, incapable of learning and repenting from sins.
They can’t differentiate reality from their autogenerated images, and therefore won’t know the
difference between any outcomes.
Secondly, the desecration of the law of the covenant. The law and guilt inflicted upon
one’s soul is seen by the man as too burdensome. Therefore, he extracts any desire he has to do
good, meaning, as explained previously, he extracts his desire for paradise, and by this means he
destroys his understanding of perfection, and therefore destroys his reference point for moral
law. By this, he destroys his capacity to understand or desire love, because moral law internally
and externally is on the basis of love. Therefore, he accomplishes his goal to eliminate any
portion of him which desires sacrifice and meaning so that he may indulge in pleasure limitlessly
and have his false heaven. This notion is, frighteningly, akin to the notions of Bhudda, which
teaches that Nirvana is obtained by completely eliminating desire within oneself. This is
incorrect, since humans also possess desires to help the poor and love others. And for this reason,
I would relate Bhudda, along with the others, to an antichrist. And I think Buddhism is likely
working by Satan’s plan to eventually accomplish such a thing, as I see people around me be
persuaded, sadly, by these doctrines.
Last of all, the removal of the manna. Since the person has destroyed their ability to
sacrifice, learn, and love, the light of spiritual sustenance ceases from them, and they become
darkness. The life that is given to them by Christ is now removed, and they are no longer
sustained by any spiritual means, but have become only carnal and of the world. Their
connection to heaven has ceased, and they are only beings of flesh and carnality. They have
become one amalgamated beast. They are the incompleteness of man, who was made on the
sixth day, and therefore does not enter into the seventh day of God’s rest. They unwittingly
subject themselves to their own hell and torment by destroying love and light in them, perhaps
doing so by giving themselves extended life, and giving themselves only sensuality and hatred.
They, therefore, will have no rest. And perhaps they craft for themselves a means to extend their
lives, being wanting of heaven, and therefore give themselves to eternal torment. They therefore
are of the number 666. Incompletion of incompletion. They are not created any longer, but
stagnant in evil, and never entered the complete story and salvation designed for them by God.
And for this reason, whoever obtains the mark will not be found in the book of life.
And by this, we may relate the abomination of desolation, Neuralink, and the mark of the
beast. And we may understand why Christ’s zeal for these things in the gospels occurs, for in the
chapters when Christ mentions the temple, He also mentions the apocalypse. He zealously tells
the merchants to get out of His temple, because they have transformed it into a den of thieves. He
then proceeds to speak of the end of days. For Christ knows that in the latter days the internal
temple will become a shopping center, in which the people only consume with their purchases,
and worship the quantified system, which is money. And they therefore desecrate the temple by
making it a den of thieves, which steal with purchase by no sacrifice their lusts.
And moreover, Christ precedes these sayings with statements of blasphemy of the Holy
Spirit. Since the Spirit resides in Christians, it may be understood that the desecration of where it
lives is blasphemy of it. And for this reason, it is unforgivable. For how can one find their way
back to Christ after entering the event horizon which is the mark of the beast? And I call it an
event horizon because that is the portion of a black hole where no one is able to escape.
In fact, this event horizon occurs when the abomination first is established. When people
begin inputting Neuralink into their innermost functions and DNA, this is the erection of the
abomination of desolation in the holiest place. Moreover, they will have access to control of
technology with their minds and limitless knowledge. They will then be able to perform signs
and wonders, and no one may be able to make war with them. And they will inflict their evil
upon the saints and prevail for the time God has ordained for them. But do not be fooled nor take
the mark of the beast. And endure with patience and courage, do not fight with sword or flame,
remembering the promise of afterlife by Christ. And moreover, understand that salvation is not
by intellect, which is a philosophy of Lucifer, but is by the faith and love in Christ.
I thank you Lord that these things were not revealed to the wise and prudent, but to the
mouths of babes.
The abomination of desolation is the establishment of infinite prosperity to sustain
humanity by robotics and automation. Neuralink is the mark of the beast and the erection of the
abomination in the holiest place, giving infinite knowledge and lusts to men, who are deceived
and deluded to believe this is their salvation. All these things will be brought about by an
incredible delusion of hypocrites killing Christians, claiming they “oppose” the good man-made
heaven, and therefore are driven to hate for them, in the same way Cain was driven to hate on
righteous Abel. So, therefore, they will construct with their intellect grand weapons and wonders.
And therefore, the kings of the earth will do great evil to enforce establishment of their vain
attempts for heaven, and as said in the book of Daniel, “will worship a god of fortresses, of
whom their fathers did not know they would worship, and they will honor it with gold and
silver.” It is of fortresses because of weapons and technology; of gold and silver for these are the
main conductors and primary metals to create databases, microchips, and AI; unknown to the
fathers because they could not foresee such strange nature of a false god. And therefore, when
such an event horizon occurs—when you see the abomination of desolation in the holiest
place—as Christ says, run for the hills. Jesus Christ be with you, Amen.

Part II: Deeper Analysis and Interpretation.
The Dragon
The Mother
The Harlot of Babylon
Demons in Babylon
The Plagues
